website_summaries.verdict: For those who seek a stylish winter weather driving glove, this Italian model from Elma is one to consider.
pros: Luxurious leather outer shell with a cashmere lining
Allows wearers to use electronic devices
Stylish appearance as cold weather driving gloves
cons: Relatively thin for "winter" gloves, not well-insulated
Many inferior knock-offs on the market

customer_reviews.title: Wedding Anniversary Gift for My Husband
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves as a 3rd wedding anniversary for my husband, as the traditional third wedding anniversary gift is leather. I purchased these in size 9.5 US standard Men's size with the cashmere knitted lining. My husband loved them and they fit him nicely. He was very satisfied at how warm they keep his hands with winter now here. They are very soft and pliable. The touchscreen texting ability of these gloves do work, it's just that is seems that he has to use the very tip/point of the glove to be able to use the ability. Think like using your fingernail to navigate a touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: haha_yeahTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, but...
customer_reviews.text: I got the cashmere option and absolutely love the materials of these gloves! However there are two issues with these gloves: first the cuffs aren't tapered/tight, which leads to an air gap between the gloves and the wrists that can allow for cold air to enter the gloves. They should've made the cuffs with some elastic material that would make an air tight seal at the wrists. Secondly the finger slots for the index, pinky, and thumb are too long, which creates an empty flap at the end of the glove that reduces finger dexterity.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Don't usually give 5 stars but these gloves are real sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the brown cashmere gloves. I received them in a nice gift box with a ribbon. Very classy. I ordered 8.5 size which is one inch larger than the measurement from my palm to my longest finger; but they fit like a "glove"! I dont like extra room at the finger tips with leather gloves. I like them tighter for driving and mobility. Beautiful leather on these gloves. Don't know how warm they are until I try them out. I am looking forward to wearing them this winter. It would be difficult to find anything of similar quality for this price in the Chicagoland area. Thus, recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Murray Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves - stick with fleece lining version!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 3 pair of these gloves and I love them (I keep losing them - hence the 3rd pair). I opted for the cashmere lining on this round because I was feeling a little fancy. It was a bad call... I only lost one glove this round and when I put on the cashmere/wool vs the fleece there is a HANDS DOWN (no pun intended) winner in the fleece. It's much thicker, much softer, less itchy. Not to mention the fleece is at a lower price point. If you read this and are thinking about which one to buy. DO NOT think twice. You will be MUCH happier with the fleece. However, this is still a quality glove.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Kirsch

customer_reviews.title: Really good value
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look a lot more expensive than they are. I do get compliments when I wear them. They fit a little tight, but they eventually stretched out a bit too make it a good fit. You cannot use them with touchscreens. They are just too think for that matter. I think these are simply for comfort, style, warmth, and driving, not to be playing on your gadgets with nor messing with your navigation in the car. You will have to take them off for those matters. They are very stylish indeed.
customer_reviews.author: German

customer_reviews.title: Product Arrived SEVERELY Damaged
customer_reviews.text: My pair of gloves arrived severely damaged, as you can see in the picture. I'm guessing what happened was when it was bulk-packaged and transported from the manufacturer, before being individually packaged, it was damaged by the packing/shipping materials. This was very upsetting and disappointing because I ordered and received this pair of gloves right before a ski trip (not for skiing, but just for the cold weather), so when I noticed that it was damaged upon arrival, I didn't have enough time to get a replacement before leaving on the trip. I ended up returning for a refund after my trip, and didn't have a decent pair of gloves on the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Leo L.

customer_reviews.title: Good touchscreen gloves, but terrible at keeping your hands warm.
customer_reviews.text: Buy this pair if you are interested in something fashionable. However, if you are looking for something warm, like I was, then these pairs are not helpful. The touchscreen capability is fantastic, but the fingertips of these gloves feels colder than the environment and I cannot wear them for too long outside. Moreover, the product they sent me seemed old. The leather was worn and did not have the new leather shine.
customer_reviews.author: cosmosis

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen not great, fantastic gloves!
customer_reviews.text: First, I didn't expect these to work at all with a touchscreen so I am not disappointed at all that they don't work well. I bought these hoping they would be warm enough to wear casually in the cold Utah winter, and I'm thrilled. The cashmere option is very warm, the leather is tight but forgiving, and the fit is excellent (I used a tape measurer to measure around the palm and back of my hand, there are many sites that give very easy to follow instructions). I'm thrilled that the fit is nearly perfect. Unless you're doing extended outside work in the cold, these are perfect, and I'd recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Callister

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away - Does not work with my iPhone - Not warm - Poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: Junk - They do not work texting and they are poorly made - I purchased it because of the high reviews - Trust me and buy something else Also they are cut large in the fingers but short in the palm (wrist).
customer_reviews.author: ericknowsbest

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have noted these are nicer than expected. I’m taking off one star because the lining is very fuzzy and shedding quite a bit so I’m uncertain of the authenticity/quality of the cashmere but it is very warm and soft. Because I live in a cold snowy climate I treated these with Obenauf’s heavy duty leather preservative to assist waterproofing and prolong the life of the gloves. This darkened the leather quite a bit and took away the original somewhat glossy finish... but I’m not a very fancy man and now these should last for many years with continued maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves fit perfectly. The leather is extremely soft. And that’s where it ends for me. The second time I wore the gloves, they ripped open between the middle and ring finger of the left hand on the palm side. It doesn’t look like the stitching caught enough of the leather when sewing the seam. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: R. WiseTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, low quality falls apart fast
customer_reviews.text: Stitching of thumb section on one of the gloves fell apart after 2 weeks of use and now a hole is starting to be visible. The other one does not have the same issue but I can't wear them now because of the hole.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Select size accurately.
customer_reviews.text: I liked these gloves first time I saw them. They look grand! But choose size accurately, guys. Because with my hand measures size number 9 of the gloves was appropriate for me and I ordered that ones. But it was a little bit small in size so I cannot fully unbend my thumb in gloves. But I am giving 5 stars, because it is not a big deal and probably I could make mistakes in measuring my hand or not be aware about size subtleties in USA. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Seymur

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove, not too warm in cold weather; cashmere very thin
customer_reviews.text: There are nice glove - very soft - a bit tight fitting. I would consider on size larger that you normally wear. I don't think I would pay extra for the cashmere lining - it's very thin overall and doesn't really add any warmth. Perhaps it's a bit softer than the fllece lining. They are not the kind of gloves that are going to keep your hands warm on cold days. I wore mine on a 25F day and my fingers were cold after a few minutes. They do work well with cell phones using touch. Get the right size if this is important, as a tight fit is needed to have the touch work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy expecting to be able to use your phone wearing them. Or to have warm hands.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because it said touchscreen, but the small has crazy long finger tips make it impossible to type. Wearing them now. This took 10 minutes. Also thin, my hands are still chilled in 42 degree weather. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Different materials used
customer_reviews.text: The material use to make the right glove looks a lot different than the material used for the left glove. One glove is shiny and smooth and the other one feels more soft and it is all wrinkled. I am exchanging for the same item with the hope that I get a match this time. UPDATE: Got my second set today. They look much better than the last ones but there are still some differences in the materials used from the right glove and the left one. The seller was fast by sending me a second pair but I do not thing that this is worth the hassel.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy G

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING
customer_reviews.text: Not pleased. I purchased these as a Christmas gift based off of the reviews and pictures online. Expecting them to come in a nice white gift box, as many reviewers reported theirs to have arrived in, I was disappointed to see them packaged in a run-of-the-mill ugly orange envelope. I still held out hope that the actual product wouldn't be as cheaply made as the packaging, but alas, in this case, you get what you pay for. Problem is, I wouldn't have purchased at all if I had known. I don't think the other reviewers were wrong, I simply think recently the company has substantially cut manufacturing costs.... and it shows.
customer_reviews.author: katy

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are gorgeous gloves, I am very satisfied! Excellent quality, buttery leather, not too thick with the soft lining, and keeps hands warm in the cold. Worth the price. Fit is amazing! And who doesn't need touch gloves for their phone?! Would be great in a longer length as well. I purchased the black & highly recommend these gloves for men or women. These gloves are wonderful quality, and feels amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Carey Walker

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfy and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: I bought a black pair of cashmere gloves back in November 2016, and I still love them today. It’s true that they aren’t super warm gloves, but that’s really not their purpose. They are more of a driving glove, yet classy and stylish for a night on the town. As for being able to use them with a cell phone, mine work perfectly. In fact, I am ordering a new pair right now, brown cashmere, and I did it all while wearing my black gloves. Great deal for around $30.
customer_reviews.author: RBoz

customer_reviews.title: Good for Wider Smaller Hands
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed with these. Definitely didn't expect them to be this good. They fit "like a glove". Never even understood that espression until today honestly. They seemed like they'd be small when I first slid them on but once on, they are like a second skin. So soft and classy looking too. I have trouble finding gloves that fit me, I'm a bit of a chonk with shorter fingers. I'm obsessed with these.
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: Nice packaging, nice gloves, excellent fit for long fingers.
customer_reviews.text: Nice packaging (gift box), arrived quickly. Nice gloves, stitching appears very good, comfortable to wear. Measured just under 9.5 in, ordered size 9.5, and they fit perfectly, a little snug when I make a fist, but wouldn't want them loose, and should break in. I have long fingers, proportionate to my size ( 6'3", 180 lbs). Finger length on gloves is perfect. I would order up to the next size of your measurement. Will see how they last. ery happy with my purchase. Would be a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: These gloves seem very nice, however
customer_reviews.text: These gloves seem very nice, however....the thumbs are obviously too long. I ordered a size 9 (the measurement of my hand) and some of the other fingers feel a bit long as well. The thumb is an obvious length mistake, unless I just have a short thumb, but I don't believe I'm the first person to complain about this. The fit of the glove ( handwise) is good, an 8.5 might be too small. They seem to be good quality, aside from the thumb. Just be aware. Thumbs are what people text with, so it rather destroys the touchscreen capability, at least for texting.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish glove
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are quote a bargain! While they are warm, they would not work for super frigid temps as the lining is just enough to make them soft. Colors are saturated and they are buttery soft. Fit is as expected to be and the responsiveness of the gloves on ipad and iphone are also as expected. Last year's pair held up all winter and this season I ordered a few more so each winter coat has its own set - no more looking for gloves! Comes beautifully gift wrapped in a box with a cloth storage bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: ShariMari

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. They fit perfect yet still had enough room to easily grab things and move your hand around. The inside is super soft yet they still blocked the wind and kept my hands warm. I wouldn't use them on really cold days because the padding just isn't there for that but for late fall and early winter use or even just in the car or on the motorcycle, they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Rosebud

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves but bad for touchscreen use
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are very nice quality and come in nice packaging but the touchscreen capability is really bad. It really only consistently works on my left thumb and right pointer finger. Even for those fingers it will randomly stop working for a while for no reason and I have to take off my glove to operate my phone. Besides the touchscreen problems they are nice gloves for the price and I would have given them 5 stars, but for me the touchscreen functionality is make or break.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Parente

customer_reviews.title: Bad manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: Made in China. Bad stitching. Cheap lamb skin leather. Inside is falling apart. Poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES R. HAINER

customer_reviews.title: Great quality winter touchscreen gloves for men
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the quality of these gloves. My husband loves them and they fit his usually difficult to fit XL hands. Nice soft quality leather - they look less cheaply shiny than in the product photos. Soft warm plush fleece lining, and touchscreen fingertips are great for winter gloves. I don't know how that works because the touchscreen fingertips don't look visibly different from the rest of the glove, but it works well, without any apparent need to adjust placement of fingers at the tip. Packaging is very nice too if you're giving these as a gift - gloves come in a soft bag inside a nice box with a fixed ribbon bow.
customer_reviews.author: Downeast with Cats

customer_reviews.title: Super High Quality Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are gorgeous and seem to be made of high quality. I am definitely satisfied with the design, fit, and feel. I got the brown with cashmere lining, size 8.5. I measured my hand using the technique of making a flat hand and wrapping a tape measure around the knuckles. I am 5'11" 185lbs, and my hand measured 8 1/4 inches around so I rounded up to 8.5 and they fit me perfectly. These things are so nice and soft that I strictly wear them for driving/walking only, no heavy lifting with these on, although they could probably handle it they don't deserve that kind of abuse. Overall very satisfied with the gloves, shipping speed, and overall price.
customer_reviews.author: Beezy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality - Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: These are the 2nd pair of these gloves that I have purchased (one for each car). The first pair I ordered in size 8.5 fit perfectly. I have medium to large hands and the other size 8.5 well. I pair I just received are so small that I literally can not even get my hand into the glove! Regrettably I will be returning these for a refund. Otherwise I was happy with the quality of the glove and its touchscreen feature worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: BRT356

customer_reviews.title: I really like these gloves. They are tight though.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are very well made. They are classy and feel and smell great. I guess I have have somewhat fat/wide palms and shorter fingers. Normally, if I get gloves that fit my palm area correctly then the fingers are about 1/2 inch too long. On these I got a size that fits my fingers, which is very important to me. However, that causes the palm area to be quite tight. I can get them on and have been trying to contract my hand in order to try and stretch them out somewhat. Maybe that will work over time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M Moss

customer_reviews.title: color not set
customer_reviews.text: So, these are very soft leather and the cashmere is warm. And the touch works ok without a screen protector... not as well with one (one finger works well - but that's enough for me). But what was terrible was the color coming off if I touched my face. I used a waterproofing wax from another set of gloves I had and that has stopped these from bleeding for now... They need to do a better job of fixing the color! Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn these gloves twice now at work and I love them! The fit and feel is perfect and I have great dexterity with them on. Why four stars you ask...because the pointer finger on my right hand does not work on the touchscreen of my phone. The other fingers do and I can get by with it, but the finger I use the most does not!
customer_reviews.author: Matt McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves. Well made. Good fit in XL.
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. Well made. Good fit in XL. Lining is just the right thickness to keep your hands warm but still allow for tactile operations like getting your keys or wallet out of your pocket without having to remove them.
customer_reviews.author: cutter

customer_reviews.title: High quality, strange sizing?, touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: Lining is very soft and comfortable. Very high quality. They look great. They feel high quality. The only problem that I have is that the thumb seems to be disproportionately longer than the rest of the fingers, now I don't know if this is just because my thumb is shorter than the rest of my fingers, but there it is, that is my experience. Also it is important to note that I have kind of small hands. Also the touchscreen capabilities are great but, reasonably it is difficult to actually use a device with them on, as your precision is decreased significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Ellery

customer_reviews.title: Looks Amazing, but the touchscreen not so much
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look amazing. It is bigger than my hand, which is kind of clunky, but I really like it. The touch screen gimmick works sometimes and sometimes does not. The right hand, only the thumb and the index works, and the right hand only the thumb works. If you're buying this because of winter, then I will have to tell you it does not warm you hands that well. It kept my hands warm around 10-degree celsius, but if it's below 0 and windy, it does not do its job properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jun Y.

customer_reviews.title: Measure tightly for great fit
customer_reviews.text: I honestly never have been able to wear gloves. They are too bulky, or made out of flimsy material and just don't keep you warm. These are somewhere in between, and they look really nice. The cashmere lining keeps my hands warm but not sweaty. I am going to buy another pair because I'm totally gonna end up losing one of them. It'd be nice if they delivered them with a little something to connect them together when you are one using them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Impeccable Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought a saddle brown and mocha brown pair. Very, very pleasantly surprised. Just the packaging alone was impressive. Wrapped in a preservative bag, then wrapped in a heavy paper gift bag and closed with a silk bow. I have a black pair EXACTLY like these that I bought from Macy’s 2 years ago. I paid $65 for them then. These were $24. Excellent quality. Cashmere lining. Super soft leather. A perfect present for myself. Ideal gift to give any guy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, nice appearance, good price
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for about three weeks now and I wear them daily. The gloves have a nice appearance and haven't frayed/fallen apart in any way yet. The quality seems good and they have a nice fit. The touch screen feature is basically useless, which I have found to be true with any gloves that are able to interact with screens. Don't expect to be sending any text messages with fat leather glove fingers. They keep me warm and look nice, I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua  Cotes

customer_reviews.title: Probably the better of most touchscreen leather gloves out there
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a pair of leather gloves before buying this set and they were terrible with the touchscreen on my smartphone and tablet. These gloves are much better but they are not perfect. I haven't come across a decent pair of gloves that have perfect touchscreen usage abilities, so with that in consideration these are a good pair of gloves. As for warmth, these will not replace your winter gloves as it will only protect your hands from Fall weather. Winter cold will penetrate these gloves after 10-20 seconds. But if you're in the car and have a cold steering wheel, these gloves will provide good grip while not feeling cold. Probably the best use of these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: OK product, If I had received what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, bad experience. I ordered this gloves twice, the first pair came in with different material that I had ordered. I returned the first pair and ordered a second one hoping to get the right material this time. I did get the right material the second time, but the gloves were much larger than the first pair that fitted perfectly despite being the same size. Returning the second pair as well and ordering something else.
customer_reviews.author: aq1

customer_reviews.title: Not so good, I'd look at something else.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the fingers for some odd reason will respond to screen touch and others will not. It's really weird. Also, I had to pick something up off my driveway and two fingers lightly hit the pavement and the tips were badly damaged. I was really shocked at how badly damaged they were to the what I had done. They fit well, but also don't carry much thermal properties.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: I firmly don’t recommend this item and this seller
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying that this gloves are extremely poor quality and I will add pictures with the so called Luxury... this is the second pair off gloves that I have to return from this seller because I thought the first time it happened to bee a bad pair, but now I know for sure this are Chinese made probably or something because they are really bad. And now when I asked to return this pair ... I get asked to pay for the return this disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Marian

customer_reviews.title: and the inner material doesn't bother me like it does with most other gloves
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a pair of these gloves for over five years, and then someone lost one of them during the last summer. They're thin, work well both for my phone AND the lock mechanism we have on our door, keep my hands warm, and the inner material doesn't bother me like it does with most other gloves. I highly recommend these to anyone looking for gloves for winter, especially if you're looking for one that can work with any touchpad devices (phone/tablet) and even home locking systems.
customer_reviews.author: LetreivH

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: The lambskin is lightweight and very comfortable to wear. The pure cashmere liner is soft, warm, and durable. I had a pair for several years, and they still had a couple more years of use in them, but I lost them. I was very happy to find the same style still being sold, and this time I bought two pair. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Real materials - Measure and it will fit
customer_reviews.text: I got the black with cashmere lining. It is real lambskin leather and real cashmere. Very comfortable and warm. I measured my palm's circumference and from finger to base and ended up with size 8, which fit like a glove (I couldn't help myself). I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Will be great driving gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Of course, ordering these in April means I will not understand their true value until next winter, but I have tried them on, and they feel luxurious and look amazing! Only gloves like these feel right for driving. Other winter gloves may be warmer, but unless it's very frigid they are uncomfortable and bulky. 90 percent of the time, these will be excellent, classy driving gloves that almost make me look forward to winter. A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: George R. Filieau

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and fast processing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these three times. I bought and returned until i found the perfect size. Great customer service! Love that there is no risk, if it doesn’t fit -return it. I didn’t have to pay for the return. There are so light they are below the minimum weight for the blue USPS mailboxes. Definitely don’t hesitate with this vendor. An observation: the 9 to 9.5 is actually a significant upsize i made the mistake of going 9 to 10. The material is good quality. Also tried brown the first time and is a dark brown went with black last minute.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful gloves. I bought these as a gift for ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful gloves. I bought these as a gift for my husband and he loves them. High quality supple leather with cashmere lining. I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews that stated it was polyester - but mine is in fact cashmere. Just a note of caution: When you order these gloves, be sure to click on Cashmere...not fleece (which was the default). Sizing was spot on and the packaging was superior. These gloves are light weight and thin - perfect for driving.
customer_reviews.author: NCMountainGirl

customer_reviews.title: it's nice, except
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about these gloves except 1 thing that annoys the hell out of me. The fit on one glove between the index finger and the thumb is weird, and the thumb is extremely long. As I open and close my hand the thumb of the glove walks up my hand, so I keep having to pull it down for a snug fit. The other glove is not as bad, but it still happens
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Looks like plastic, built for people with absurdly long thumbs.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like plastic, built for people with absurdly long thumbs. These look like cheap driving gloves you may find at a gas station. The fit is terrible, every finger except a couple fit. The thumb was extraordinarily long.
customer_reviews.author: Papa

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but still great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an electric car. If you run the heat, you lose a little of your driving range, hence the need for some warm gloves. These aren't the warmest but they're very, very nice. The touchscreen fingertips work well on my iPhone as well as the car's touchscreen. The stitching, finish, and cashmere liner are superb. My only complaint is the fit. I measured an exact 9 around my knuckles and that part fits perfectly. However, the fingers are a little short and I probably should have ordered the 9.5s. On the positive side, there is no empty space at any of the fingertips. These are keepers.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Fingers don't always work when touching my phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like the gloves. The are very nice material and warm. I got a half size bigger and they fit snuggly. I gave them 4 stars because the fingertips don't always work when touching my phone. The only one that really works well is my right middle finger. All the other fingers only work lower down toward the joint which makes it hard to push on icons. I don't know if there is some way to fix them. Like maybe something that slid down in the fingers. Other than that they are great gloves, but I bought them specifically for the finger tips.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable,  well made gloves
customer_reviews.text: From the 1st time you pull these on you realize these are well made gloves, of good quality. Using the recommended sizing chart I was able to order the best fit 1st try. My only concern was that these are described as "driving gloves" and I expected something that improved one's grip on the wheel. It does a little, but only modestly so. Still, it's a nice pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Dale P.

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality leather. Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: What really counts is the quality of the leather and cashmere lining. They look good with the Italian leather coat I bought them for. The fit is just OK but seems to get better after wearing them. They should smell better. These smell like formaldehyde. All said, I would buy from this brand again before trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Real nice
customer_reviews.text: Real nice and comfortable . I hade these gloves for less than (24) hours. I was enjoying them and the comfort they provided. Put them on, got in my car and drove. When I got out of my car they fell to the ground I didn’t notice and I lost them. I just can’t afford to replace them but they are a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Parese-enterprise

customer_reviews.title: New to leather gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with my purchase. The insulation is minimal so if your hands are cold before you put these gloves on, they are likely to remain so. Having said that, they have provided exceptional protection from the cold, be it wind, ice, or snow. I measured my hands for the appropriate fit and purchased the size closest to my measurements; the gloves started out tight at first but have subsequently stretched for a more comfortable fit, if not a little snug. Overall I consider this a successful purchase - would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Caboose

customer_reviews.title: A little snug at first few tries...  But has enough give to finally come off easier.  Oh so warm!
customer_reviews.text: I have very large hands, at first try, was very tight. Next couple tries and making fists, helped to loosen them up to take them off easier. Can still flick a Bic with them, so I am happy. And lining? Oh, paradise for your hands. Well worth the money. Only time will tell how long they hold out. My last pair stayed as good as new for years, until lost. Hoping these will too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Spindler

customer_reviews.title: Only three stars because of color.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves fit perfectly and the cashmere keeps my hands warm. The Chestnut color is completely different that what I got they are brown. I am not going to return them because the color is just fine. Just be aware of color choice. Update : The gloves will not keep your hands warm below 40°.
customer_reviews.author: F. Cattaneo

customer_reviews.title: I can't recommend this as a glove to spend a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look sharp. They keep your hands warm in the cutting wind of winter. Where I live it can get down to -40, and that isn't with the wind chill. I can't recommend this as a glove to spend a lot of time in that frigid of a temperature. They do however keep my hands toasty as I walk from my car into work. That was really what I was looking for in this glove. I liked them so much that I bought a pair for my wife. She loved them. The box that they came in really had the feeling of premium leather product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan E

customer_reviews.title: I like these, in general
customer_reviews.text: I like these, in general: -- They are soft and good-looking. -- The cashmere lining is warm. -- The touch-screen works well with my iPhone. However, I am disappointed about the quality of the second pair I purchased (I ordered them for my partner). The seam on one of the fingers parted after a month of use (on the photo). I fixed it for now, but it seems the thread on that finger is generally worn off (so it is likely it will continue to part in other places). So the conclusion: nice product at a low price, but be prepared that quality varies somewhat from pair to pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jeu-de-paume

customer_reviews.title: It took three tries
customer_reviews.text: These are nice gloves--but. My first order came with two gloves in different sizes. Quickly returned, tried again (half a size larger). Second order arrived, actually smaller than first order! Returned, third try another half size larger. These actually fit, but I wouldn't recommend the process to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Historian

customer_reviews.title: They run long
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t ideal for my husband because while the size we ordered is right for the width of his hand, the fingers are quite long. Unfortunately we missed out on the return window. I’m still rating them five stars, because the gloves are of very nice quality and they work wonderfully with touch-screen devices. They’re also packaged well for presentation as a gift, so we’ll likely end up giving them to someone. If you have long fingers and/or thin hands, these are made for you.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These are the best dress gloves I have ever bought! The leather is top shelf and the interior is soft and comfortable. It really doesn't get very cold where I live so, the gloves are perfect for our winters where the temperature rarely gets bellow 40 degrees Fahrenheit. The packaging was a little over the top but, very classy! I am extremely happy with my purchase and would gladly do business with this company again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: gmw5555

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are amazing. Was driving with hand out the window in the dead of winter at night and could barely feel the cold air. Soft on the inside. The only issue I have is that sometimes you'll have to press down on your phone kinda hard in order to get it to register the touch. Not much of a issue for me because it is really satisfying to remove/ put on the gloves .
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Non-black colors are just painted on
customer_reviews.text: I own two pairs of the black color and they are great. Ordered the light brown, and the color began to flake off the fingertips immediately. Over the course of 20 wears or so, the color has started coming off all parts of the glove. The leather isn't dyed. There is some colored coating material that does not stand up to any contact. Disappointed I missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: AjaxMpls

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice gloves for the money. The lining is soft. They keep my hands warm. I like how grippy they are on my steering wheel. I can use touchscreen devices, but still prefer to slip them off for more accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: A. N.

customer_reviews.title: Have bought these 4 times now!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my sons one Christmas. Huge hit! They have used them for 2 years now... one just lost his and bought another pair to replace them. I bought another pair for nephew this Christmas. He really loved them (and he is picky)!!! These are beautiful, hold up to wear & tear, and are super soft. The touchscreen ability is a must-have for anyone using a smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kim from Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Truly a great buy. Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic gloves for the price. I received these same Elma gloves as a gift about 5-6 years ago, but recently left them out on my counter where my dog snatched them and chewed up a finger. I was pretty upset, but relieved when I found they are still made. I decided to repurchase these with the cashmere lining. These are my favourite non-bulky, stylish gloves that are actually really warm. I don't think you'd be disappointed with these.
customer_reviews.author: MVP

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen feature not working
customer_reviews.text: They are comfy, the leather seems of good quality and the cashmere is nice. I had the previous version of these gloves for a while and they worked great but the new version isnt working at all with any of my touch screens including a Galaxy phone that even has glove mode.
customer_reviews.author: Mibix

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, neat, great for a meet and greet
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I received two different glove styles in two different sizes. Both were very nice gloves! I, of course, returned said gloves and then got the correct pair. They look just like the image depiction and the touchscreen works quite well. They break in quite nicely and the dark brown really is a good fashion combo for anything
customer_reviews.author: Hayden F

customer_reviews.title: Not snug or warm
customer_reviews.text: I tried two sizes, one was too small, half size up was too big. I know I have long fingers, so your mileage may vary; however, my last pair of gloves fit perfectly. Leather is great quality. Wrists are not really protected and the cuff gets in the way of your coat sleeve, which is a pet peeve. Cashmere does not keep hand very warm even a bit above freezine. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and supple gloves
customer_reviews.text: The leather on these gloves is very supple and the insulation really keep my hands warm. I really like the fact that I can use my cell phone with out having to remove my gloves. I couldn't find nice gloves in any stores near my and I'm glad I took a chance on these!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry S.

customer_reviews.title: The title doesn’t lie! Very luxurious indeed
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband, they were perfect size, the way they be arrived was interesting, the came in a big envelope and inside of a pouch so they were very well protected. The leather is very soft and the cashmere feeling is amazing according to my hubby. Very nice gift 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Rosa M. Ponce

customer_reviews.title: You get exactly what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The touchscreen feature works really well, but as far as the rich cashmere lining it’s all very sparse. The lining being cashmere is barely noticeable and the leather is pretty nice for the price, but these are just $30 gloves. You get what you pay for. So for $30 they are pretty good. I think I would have given them 5 stars had I gone with the non cashmere lining and saved a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: BenG K

customer_reviews.title: Definitely reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Gave 2 of these as gifts. Both have said they are amazing and have a perfect fit. The sensitivity for their phone is great and they have had no troubles with screen use. Both remarked that they are really stylish as well. So happy with this, I will be getting these for all the men in my life. Definitely reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Griff321

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, Comfy and Warm
customer_reviews.text: What else can you ask for in a glove? I'd like the think I have a decent idea of men's fashion. After all, one of the girls at work thought I shopped at H&M (and I do all my clothes shopping at Kohl's and on Amazon). I bought these for sub-zero temperatures during winter, and they're worth every penny. They go well with my leather coat, and the touch screen finger tips actually work! I bought the ones with cashmere lined on the inside, and I love them. I used the scale that amazon provided, measured my hand with a sewing tape measure, and the gloves fit perfectly. Super happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality! True leather. Feels great when worn and keeps your hands warm. It also give you that "My names Bond, James Bond" feel when wearing them. They are that stylish. My on critique I have, is the index finger (The touch screen finger) feels a bit bigger on the finger tip than a normal glove. This will leave your finger when trying to text or skip a song on your phone, seem inaccurate. Other than that, this is a great purchase! I would Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: These are very soft and very comfortable. I bought a pair for my husband and fell in love with them so I bought another pair for myself. I bought the fleece lining and just love the gloves. I won't say that they are super warm but for driving they are great. My husband likes that he can control the heater without turning on the wipers. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive marketing
customer_reviews.text: The “touchscreen” aspect of these gloves is outright deceptive. These do not work with any touchscreen I have tried them on at all. Other then that they’re fine as gloves, just vastly overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Been living in LA for 5 years and had to go back east during the winter. Couldn't find my gloves so ordered these at the last minute. They arrived just in time and they look and feel great. If I didn't know better, I would have thought they cost more than $30 price tag. Solid product
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working with touch screen after one week
customer_reviews.text: Fantastically comfortable and reasonably dextrous, yet sturdy enough to do medium-duty work like packing a moving truck with furniture. Extremely warm, yet thin. Capacitive quality works great on touchscreens, but only the "front" (palm-side) of the tips of the thumb, index finger, and middle finger are capacitive - not the sides or ends, so you can't reliably tap with the very tip of your finger, or brush the screen with the side of your finger tip. But none of the above is relevant, because the index finger completely stopped working on touch screens after one week of use.
customer_reviews.author: dbplunkett

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully Made!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing one pair of these gloves as a gift to my son, I was so impressed with the quality for the cost that I ordered several more pairs to give to other family members. These gloves are stylish for any age, made of soft, supple leather, and fit just right. EVERY single guy that got them has raved about them!
customer_reviews.author: L Silver

customer_reviews.title: Almost
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first pair with cashmere linings fits great and the leather softened after good uses. But when I ordered the black one with fleece lining the left glove fits well and the right one is hard to put my hand in. Might be an irregularity in the way these were made. I have to really try hard to put my hand in. But,I'll make do.
customer_reviews.author: charlie bronson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: These seem like luxury gloves for a fraction of the price I have paid for other leather gloves. The touch screen feature actually works and they fit well. The lining is soft and warm. Haven't used them very long so not sure how durable they will be, but they are beautiful and look much more expensive than they were. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cahumiko

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. Amazing quality for the price. When I measured my hands as instructed, they measured as 8.5 inches. So I went with size 9. But they still feel a bit too snug for me, I got long lanky fingers. I might go with the 9.5s. Overall, these are the best looking gloves I have ever owned, and keep your hands nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Simply excellent gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are awesome. Very grippy for driving, almost too grippy. Very stylish and comfortable. I bought them to go with my new suits and coats. The inside is so soft and smooth that they slip off my hand a little too easily, but it has never been a problem. I've never had them actually slip off. Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a reasonably priced pair of stylish gloves to wear with a nice topcoat or sportcoat.
customer_reviews.author: drjps

customer_reviews.title: Great, sleek and warm!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pair of dress leather gloves, but I did not want to pay too much. At this price point and with this quality, these were a great buy. I have had multiple compliments on these. They run a little snug, but they break in a little. My wife was jealous of these, and she bought the female equivalent for herself.
customer_reviews.author: nathan ritter

customer_reviews.title: Made well. Does its job. Fancy.
customer_reviews.text: Well made gloves. Shell has no issues, stitching is done well and the inner cashmere feels very nice. I wear these gloves for going out for 20-45 min stints in cold weather. They hold up pretty well until it starts getting in to the teens, then I start putting my hands in my coat pockets. Would buy again and have recieved compliments on their look and feel. Coworkers have expressed interest in getting their own.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Angel

customer_reviews.title: Ok Glove.
customer_reviews.text: So far, 50s in Phoenix, Arizona. Cold starts around low 70s for most, around 60s for me. My hands are the worst to be felt cold, especially tendon surgery. However, I have wool gloves, it feels a little cheap than it should be. Leather works well with my touchscreen smart phone (gs7) Haven't tested it for longer than 15 minutes, even with my hand outside the car hitting wind at 40mph, it did well I measured my hand to appopriate size, the width is fine but the length my fingers must be shorter than normal or the size doesn't fit well with the fingers on this glove.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Dean, RD

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves! They feel soft and comfortable inside. I can use them when I drive since they feel “tacky” on the wheel. I measured my hand before ordering to get the right size. When I first got them, they seemed a little tight. After wearing them for 2-3 weeks, they have stretched out a bit and fit perfectly! Very satisfied customer ;)
customer_reviews.author: Shane L.

customer_reviews.title: Long Fingers NEED LG-Sized Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Soft Leather, as described. Soft cashmere inside is very warm. ADVICE: Buy a size larger for comfort IF you have longer (piano/guitar-playing) fingers. (not necessarily LG hands, IDK?) No comment about the texting feature, my husband DOES NOT TEXT WHILE DRIVING, we don't know anyone who does... :) But in the cold NE winter, these gloves are super great! From experience, the larger size is most comfortable and fit up to the wrist properly with an instrument playing hand. Happy New Year 2016!
customer_reviews.author: Mary929W

customer_reviews.title: Best driving glove I’ve ever bought under $150! Alaskan cold weather review!
customer_reviews.text: Alaskan resident here - just received these and after a drive home in a frigid truck, I am very impressed. The fit and finish is astounding! The cashmere lining is perfect for a driving glove In sub-zero temps, but I do feel like they run a bit big. I will likely buy a second pair half a size down, and I recommend if you order them, you do the same. I measure out as a solid 9.5 and judging the way these fit and feel I am sure they will stretch over time. These are a GREAT glove, and I don’t think you could find anything better under $150-200! Stop hesitating, and buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua kerr

customer_reviews.title: Warm and technology friendly
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend loved them. He has a job where he’s constantly outside even during the winter. He couldn’t get gloves because he needed to use multiple touch screens for work. These keep his hands warm and he never has to take them off. He told me he’s had compliments from his coworkers. :) great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Katie R.

customer_reviews.title: Great as dress or driving gloves
customer_reviews.text: As driving gloves, or dress winter gloves, these are great! If you're looking for something to keep your hands warm for long periods of time, you might want to find something a little thicker
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality soft leather that works with my phone and tablet, soft cashmere lining, exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Your Hands Warm and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful and amazing gloves. They're soft, supple and aristocratic. I am out in the Chicago cold every day and wear them as I walk to work. My fingers never go numb. However, my coworkers think I look like I've just murdered someone. They kind of have an OJ appeal.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Walker

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable glove I've had
customer_reviews.text: The overall design and materials used for these gloves is not bad however it's the stitching is what makes it terrible, about an inch apart from the tip of each finger there is stitching attaching a touch screen sensitive type of material, the problem for me is that when you are holding the steering wheel this really think stitching inside of the glove rubs again my thumb and after an hour of driving feels very uncomfortable. All previous glove I've owened had been constructed from a single sheet of leather not stitched up half way in between each thumb. I've taken a picture to show this design
customer_reviews.author: Anonymoussss

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves! They came in handy during a week in Seattle recently. Very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for driving a manual transmission car with the leather's ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredible quality and functionality for the money. Battle-tested in a Bavarian winter while building snowmen; the gloves are warm, waterproof, and can class-up an outfit when going out at night. Perfect for driving a manual transmission car with the leather's grip, perfect for driving as the leather transmits good feel from the steering wheel. Win-win-win. I ordered another pair for the wife (ladies style of course).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific gloves but sized on the small side
customer_reviews.text: If your hands are larger than average, even if you don't think they're that large, get the XL. At first I ordered merely the large size and they were too small, but the XLs fit just right. If your hands are genuinely super-large, is there an XXL size? You might be out-of-luck. Otherwise, terrific gloves and they really do work with touchscreen interfaces and electronic car-locking mechanisms like on my 2016 VW Golf SE. That's really nice, since I live in MN.
customer_reviews.author: Vir desideriorum

product_meta.title: ELMA Winter Leather Gloves for Men - Mens Cashmere/Fleece Lined Glove for Motorcycle Driving Riding Black Brown

【📱Touch screen Function】: No need to take off your gloves when using your phone or a GPS, It makes easy to use the cell phone sensitively and use it conveniently when doing outdoor activities.

【🥇 Lining 1】Cashmere Lining: Made of 100% Pure Cashmere. Cashmere is a beautiful natural fibre from the hair of mountain goats that is supremely soft, warm and lightweight. This lining keep your hands warm and extremely comfortable during the chilly weather.

【🥇 Lining 2】Fleece Lining: Made of 100% Polyester Fleece. This Material lasts longer than cashmere or wool. It's much thicker than cashmere. This warm, fuzzy material is strong, holds in heat and dries quickly.
